page.title: 13Farming in Yelden
page.content: Farming is the principle industry. 90% of the area is farmed by only 4 farmers or farming companies. Only 1 farm has more than 100 cows for milking. The main crops grown are winter wheat, oil seed rape and winter barley. The soil is fertile and grows good crops but only after intensive land drainage. Very few men are employed on the land as the farms are highly mechanised. The field sizes are generally 30-40 acres. Orchard Farm are Agricultural Contractors and are employed by the County Council to cut the verges and tend the woodlands.They are also wood merchants and supply many villagers with loggs at Â£12 per half load. A mobile sheep-dipping, lambing and shearing service is run from Bottom Farm.
